info.ganglia.metric
Class GMetric

java.lang.Object
  info.ganglia.metric.GMetric
Direct Known Subclasses:
GMetricDouble, GMetricFloat, GMetricInteger, GMetricString
public class GMetric
extends java.lang.Object

Base class for GMetrics. Metrics are broken out and instantiated based on type for performance and scalability considerations. This class provides GMetric functionality unrelated to the specific GMetric type.

Constructor Detail

GMetric

public GMetric(java.lang.String host,
               java.lang.String name,
               java.lang.String type,
               java.lang.String units,
               int slope,
               boolean additive)
Constructor creates GMetric with specified arguments

Parameters:
host - The hostname of the client server
name - The name of the metric (e.g. "CPU Usage"). Shows on graph
type - The type of the value. See GMetric constants.
units - The units used to measure the metric. Shows on graph
slope - See GMetric constants.
additive - If false the GMetric values are reset to 0 after update. If true the GMetric values are additive.
Throws:
java.io.IOException
Method Detail

getMetaData

public byte[] getMetaData()
Fetches metadata for this GMetric

Returns:

isAdditive

public boolean isAdditive()
Returns false if this GMetric resets values to 0 after it sends an update or true if it's additive

Returns:
the clearValues
